title: Why did Ashoka kill his brothers? - Quora

response.answer_text: Royal carpet is red for a reason - it is soaked in the blood of ALL the people kings have to kill to get there.  More than any, they have to kill the humanity inside themselves to grab the throne from all others who lay their claim to it.   This is as it has always been - since time immemorial. Ramayan is probably the only epic where Rama and his brothers were unwilling to stab each other in the back to get the throne.   Study the history and you will see that not only Ashoka, but most kings, Emperors, presidents, priminsters, chiefs, CEOs and general managers in all cultures have had to physically or metaphorically 'remove' their rivals to get to the top.  It is just the way it is - and will be - forever.  Here are just a few other examples - Aurangzeb killed a large number of brothers, cousins and relatives to get to the throne.  Mrs Margaret Thatcher was knifed in the back as Conservative MPs replaced her while she was still serving as the elected PM of England.  The Milliband brothers Ed and David fell out over leadership contest for UK's Labour party in 2010.
